perturbation.original_text: TL will hold exclusive worldwide rights to promote and sell the product through the following distribution channels: Outgoing telemarketing, General Market retail, and General Market catalogs, and exclusive rights within the United States for Television Direct response. TL will have Internet and e-commerce rights with respect to its own web site and other General Market e-commerce. In addition, TL may cross-sell the products to its internal list by inserts placed in mailings for other TL products and services (but excluding direct mail campaigns for the Product.) TL may obtain television and/or direct response rights in certain international territories upon Integrity's agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: TL will hold exclusive worldwide rights to promote and sell the product through the following distribution channels: Outgoing telemarketing, General Market retail, and General Market catalogs, and exclusive rights within the United States for Television Direct response. TL will have Internet and e-commerce rights with respect to its own web site and other General Market e-commerce. In addition, TL may cross-sell the products to its internal list by inserts placed in mailings for other TL products and services (but excluding direct mail campaigns for the Product.) TL may obtain television and/or direct response rights in certain international territories even without Integrity's agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that TL may obtain television and/or direct response rights in certain international territories *upon Integrity's agreement*. The modified text removes this requirement, stating TL may obtain these rights *even without* Integrity's agreement. This creates a direct contradiction regarding the necessity of Integrity's approval for TL to obtain those rights.

perturbation.original_text: Integrity will hold exclusive worldwide rights to promote and sell the product to/through the following distribution channels: Christian retail (CBA or Christian Booksellers Association markets), direct mail (including continuity sales, church sales, digital and e-commerce sales.) Integrity will have Internet and e-commerce rights with respect to its own web site and other Christian e-commerce. Integrity shall have the right to license distribution of the Product through all channels of distribution throughout the remainder of the world.
perturbation.changed_text: Integrity will hold exclusive worldwide rights to promote and sell the product to/through the following distribution channels: Christian retail (CBA or Christian Booksellers Association markets), direct mail (including continuity sales, church sales, digital and e-commerce sales.) Integrity will have Internet and e-commerce rights with respect to its own web site and other Christian e-commerce. Integrity shall not have any rights to license distribution of the Product through all channels of distribution throughout the remainder of the world.
perturbation.explanation: The original text grants Integrity the right to license distribution of the Product through all channels of distribution throughout the remainder of the world. The modified text explicitly denies Integrity any right to license distribution. This creates a direct contradiction about Integrity's right to license distribution in the remainder of the world.

perturbation.original_text: Either party may, at its election, assign this Agreement or any of its rights or delegate any of its obligations hereunder, in whole or in part, to any person, firm or corporation owning or acquiring all or a substantial portion of its assets, to any person, firm or corporation that is related to it as an affiliate, subsidiary or otherwise, or to any person, firm or corporation into which or with it might merge or consolidate. In the event of such an assignment by either party of its rights to an unrelated third party, the other party shall be given written notice, then in such event the other party may upon six-months (6-months) written notice terminate this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: Either party may, at its election, assign this Agreement or any of its rights or delegate any of its obligations hereunder, in whole or in part, to any person, firm or corporation owning or acquiring all or a substantial portion of its assets, to any person, firm or corporation that is related to it as an affiliate, subsidiary or otherwise, or to any person, firm or corporation into which or with it might merge or consolidate. In the event of such an assignment by either party of its rights to an unrelated third party, the other party shall not be given written notice, then in such event the other party may upon six-months (6-months) written notice terminate this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original states that when an assignment to a third party happens, the other party will be notified, then has right to terminate the agreement. However, the edited one has it where the other party won't be notified for such event, but they can still terminate the agreement regardless.
